intro: Paullinia wurdackii, commonly known as the yellow soursop, is a member of the Sapindaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a small evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, yellow fruit with a distinctive spiky exterior, which contains a single large seed. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
